title: Chloe Goodman and her sister Lauryn team skimpy lingerie with knee-high boots at Halloween bash
text:
They regularly keep their fans entertained with a seemingly endless streams of snaps from their sun-soaked getaways and nights on the town, among other pursuits.

And Chloe Goodman, 26, and her sister Lauryn, 27, stayed true to form on Sunday, when they stepped out for the Nuage Halloween Party at Manchester's Gaucho.

The siblings turned heads as they made their way into the bash wearing black lingerie, which they teamed with knee-high boots and fishnet tights.

Sister, Sister: Chloe Goodman, 26, and her sister Lauryn, 27,stepped out for the Nuage Halloween Party at Manchester's Gaucho on Sunday night

Chloe opted for a velvet body, giving her look the festive touch with the addition of scary makeup, applied to make her resemble a ghoulish skeleton.

Wearing her honey brown tresses in a high ponytail, she accessorised with a pair of oversized hoop earrings and a small black handbag.

Meanwhile, Lauryn opted for a frilly bustier, which she paired with matching panties and lacy gloves, while her makeup theme included jewels around her eyes.

Barely there ensembles: The siblings turned heads as they made their way into the bash wearing black lingerie, which they teamed with knee-high boots and fishnet tights

At the bash, the sisters mingled with a host of reality stars, including Jemma Lucy and Ellie Brown.

Chloe recently opened up to MailOnline about going through a cancer scare following a routine smear test, leaving her thinking about having children with Grant Hall - her boyfriend of just over a year - earlier than planned.

The former Celebrity Big Brother star had her first cervical screening when she turned 25 last year, but soon realised something was wrong when doctors called her up the next day.

Chloe admitted that her anxiety went from 'zero to 100' after thinking her smear test would come back normal and suddenly realised it was a 'little more serious'.

Ghoulish: Chloe opted for a velvet body, giving her look the festive touch with the addition of scary makeup, applied to make her resemble a ghoulish skeleton

Taking about the experience, she said: 'I'm a super strong person, I've dealt with a miscarriage, I gave birth to a dead baby, which was horrendous.

'I've dealt with getting engaged and three months later breaking up, I've dealt with a huge heap of s**t. At that moment when I passed out, I just knew I needed to get rid of whatever was bad, I could feel it.

Chloe has now brought forward her baby plans and praised her sportsman boyfriend for being so supportive during her health scare.

She told MailOnline: 'It's a difficult one, Grant's contract at QPR finishes in the summer next year, so do I either get pregnant in the summer this year and then he's there for the birth?

'Or we try next year, but he may have moved clubs or football teams - then I'm pregnant without him. Grant was so patient and good. He said, "If we need to have a baby now, I will, I will give you a baby"!'
description: The sisters commanded attention when they stepped out for the Nuage Halloween Party at Manchester's Gaucho on Sunday night.
